questiontext.text:
Examples

Find the first three terms in the expansions of the following.

  1. \(\frac{2}{(1-3x)}\) for \(|x| < \frac{1}{3}\).
  2. \((2 + 3x)^{-\frac{2}{3}}\) for \(|x| < \frac{2}{3}\).

Solutions

  1. Here we write \(\frac{2}{(1-3x)} = 2(1-3x)^{-1}\). Then using the expansion formulas above we have \[ \begin{align*} 2(1-3x)^{-1} &= 2 \left( 1 + 3x + \frac{-1(-1-1)}{2!} (-3x^2) + \frac{-1(-1-1)(-1-2)}{3!} (-3x^3)\right) \\ &= 2 \left( 1 + 3x + 9x^2 + 27x^3 \right) \\ &= 2 + 6x + 18x^2 + 54x^3. \end{align*} \]
  2. Here, we can write \((2 + 3x)^{-\frac{2}{3}} = 2^{-\frac{2}{3}}(1 + \frac{3x}{2})\). Thus we can use the formulas above with \(n = -\frac{2}{3}\) and we use \(\frac{3}{2} x\) in place of \(x\). So we can expand the binomial as follows: \[ \begin{align*} 2^{-\frac{2}{3}}(1 + \frac{3x}{2}) &= 2^{-\frac{2}{3}} \left(1 + (-x) + \frac{\frac{2}{3}(-\frac{2}{3}-1)}{2!} (\frac{3x}{2})^2 + \frac{\frac{-2}{3}(\frac{-2}{3}-1)(\frac{-2}{3}-2)}{3!} (\frac{3x}{2})^3 \right) \\ &= 2^{-\frac{2}{3}} \left( 1 - x + \frac{5}{4} x^2 - \frac{5}{3}x^3 \right) \\ &= 2^{-\frac{2}{3}} - 2^{-\frac{2}{3}}x + \frac{5 \cdot 2^{-\frac{2}{3}}}{4}x^2 - \frac{5 \cdot 2^{-\frac{2}{3}}}{3}x^3. \end{align*} \]
